description: multiple sheets of perforated paper bound together with a brown cardboard front cover and brown binding and missing back cover; first page in sketchbook is blank except for a black ink stain at the bottom center; second page of sketchbook has the head of a woman drawn in graphite in a blocky, sphinx-like manner; black ink is used around the top of the head; the following page on both recto and verso has cursive writing in graphite and in German listing items with Roman numerals; the following pages are blank except for a few paint and ink stains; multiple pages have been torn from the sketchbook, particularly at the front of the book
inscription: LLC of front cover, in graphite: 1603
medium: Graphite and black ink on paper
title: Sketchbook with parchment sheets and drawing titled Head of a Woman, Somewhat like a Sphinx
